intro: Micrandra rossiana, commonly known as the Ross's micrandra, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Micrandra rossiana is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
